page.title: 20 Ryedown Farm;West Wellow.
page.content: This is one of the few working farms in Wellow.It has 217 acres,50 of wheat, 29 of winter barley,14 of oats,and 17 of fodder beet.There are 17 acres of wood.Crop rotation is practised over five years.Mr.Windell keeps 43 Friesian cows and one bull,29 yearlings,28 calves.The products of the farm are: wheat,barley,oats,beet,beef,milk.Each cow produces 6250 litres per year.The E.E.C.policy has led to a reduction in the herd by three.Farm buildings consist of barns and milking parlour. There is no paid labour.Machinery used was mostly rented.The soil on the farm is a mixture of gravel,white sand and heavy loam.The relief is gently undulating and drainage is poor. By Kirsten Cavalier,Amy Murphy, Lucianne Wainwright,Sophie Beaver.
